rows.title: Why breastfeed?
rows.text: Breastfeeding keeps a baby strong and protects a child from getting sick.  A mother's milk is the perfect food.
rows.reference:
Baby WASH Programming. UNICEF Eastern and Southern Africa: UNICEF; 2020.  

Extract:  
Breastfeeding protects against the two leading causes of death in children under 5 years – pneumonia and diarrhea.

rows.title: Breastfeeding Tips
rows.text:
*  Remember, your baby loves to explore, so keep your baby's mouth and hands clean (including your own) before it's time for a feed.
*  Breastfeeding is thirsty work, make sure the mother drinks enough clean water and eats a healthy diet.  Energy is needed!
*  The World Health Organization recommends exclusive breastfeeding for the first six months of a baby's life.  No other food or water is needed. After six months, children should eat complementary food and continue to breasfeed until they are two and beyond.
rows.reference:
Baby WASH Programming. UNICEF Eastern and Southern Africa: UNICEF; 2020.  

Extract:  
Care should be taken to keep contamination from other areas away from the baby’s mouth and hands.


WHO Breastfeeding Recommendations. 

Extract:
*  WHO and UNICEF recommend that children initiate breastfeeding within the first hour of birth and be exclusively breastfed for the first 6 months of life – meaning no other foods or liquids are provided, including water. 

* Infants should be breastfed on demand – that is as often as the child wants, day and night. No bottles, teats or pacifiers should be used. 

* From the age of 6 months, children should begin eating safe and adequate complementary foods while continuing to breastfeed for up to 2 years and beyond.

rows.title: Caring for your baby
rows.text: Mothers should have access to clean water for both bathing and handwashing.  Don't forget to wash your babies face!
rows.reference:
Baby WASH Programming. UNICEF Eastern and Southern Africa: UNICEF; 2020.  

Extract:  
Provide access to sufficient clean water, pre- and post-delivery, particularly to facilitate bathing and hand washing of mother and baby.
